titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Oliver P. Jenkins Papers
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

note.p: This encoded finding aid is compliant with Stanford EAD Best Practice Guidelines, Version 1.0.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.unittitle: Oliver P. Jenkins papers
did.abstract: Papers include personal correspondence, 1891-1928; letters of introduction and reference, 1869-1888; reports of his field trips (primarily on fish), 1885-1904; and published and unpublished addresses, pamphlets, and essays, including one on children’s nature study, circa 1920, and one on a visit to California in 1873.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Oliver P. Jenkins Papers (SC0957). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Oliver Peebles Jenkins was professor and head of the Department of Physiology and Histology, Hopkins Marine Station, Stanford University (1891-1916 ; emeritus 1916-1935).

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Papers include personal correspondence, 1891-1930; letters of introduction and reference, 1869-1888; reports of his field trips (primarily on fish), 1885-1904; and published and unpublished addresses, pamphlets, and essays, including one on children’s nature study, circa 1920, and one on a visit to California in 1873.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.corpname: Stanford University. Department of Physiology and Histology. Faculty.

did.unittitle: Correspondence (incoming and outgoing)
Correspondence, outgoing to Ray Lyman Wilbur re OPJ’s pending resignation
University training for high school teachers, minutes from meeting held at Stanford
Journal of the U.S. Fish Commission exploring Virginia, Tennessee and South Carolina (hand-written entries),
Nature Study 1897 – reprint, advertisements, galleys, illustrations
Reprints (including one on the Hopkins Seaside Laboratory)
Mexican research trip documents
Correspondence regarding research trip to Hawaii
Field investigations: fishes collected in Vigo County in 1885-86
Field investigations: Virginia, Tennessee and North Carolina 1888, and Indiana 1887
Field investigations: interval between sounds of astronomical clocks, DePaugh University
Field investigations: amelids breeding during July at Pacific Grove
Field investigations: exploration of Columbia River to locate hatchery sites for Golden Trout
Manuscripts

scopecontent.p: “Sailor Spiders on Lake Maxinkuckee”; “The Campus Sickle Bills: Bird Life on the Stanford Campus,” 1920; “In considering the Question of Science as Formal Discipline,” undated; [The History of Medical Education in the United States] undated; and “What constitutes Leadership,” undated

did.unittitle: Untitled manuscript on children’s nature study
Typewritten draft of essay on children’s nature study
Research notes, possibly for children’s nature study
Essays, unidentified
Address: "Life," Washburn School Address
Address: “The True Degree Conferred by the College and Its Responsibilities,” University of the Pacific
Letters of introduction and reference, with a few certificates
Biographical and bibliographical information
Biographical essay about California in 1873
Webster Dictionary title page and frontispiece
Topographical map, California, Merced County, Planada Quadrangle
